txt.en:
'Good work, so far. Get your hands to work and forge a <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze sword, dagger, axe, great sword, or throwing axe</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Weaponsmithy tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Weaponsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>

'Grab your <rgb=#FF00FF00>smithing hammer</rgb> and make sure you have it equipped, then open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I gave you and make your way to the forge.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Weaponsmiths are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospecting profession and, in some rare cases, the woodworking profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'Let me see what you were able to do....'

He inspects the weapon with a discerning eye.

'Well-balanced, and the blade is quite sharp. This is fine work. 

'I think that you have done very, very well, [placeholder]. I approve and declare you a novice weaponsmith.'

'Let me see what you were able to do....'

He inspects the weapon with a discerning eye.

'Well-balanced, and the blade is quite sharp. This is fine work. 

'I think that you have done very, very well, [placeholder]. I approve and declare you a novice weaponsmith.'

'Let us see what you have gone and made.'

He inhales deeply and brings the weapon to eye level.

'A nice even pound to the metal. Good folding to make the blade nice and sturdy and a well-seated hilt.

'You pass, [placeholder]. You are on your way towards becoming a master weaponsmith!'
Using the ingredients you have, forge a <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze sword, dagger, axe, great sword, or throwing axe</rgb>

'I see the blade there on your person. May I see it?'

She takes a moment to admire your handiwork.

'This appears to be a well-crafted weapon. You are well on your way towards becoming a weaponsmith. Well done, [placeholder].'

'Let me see what you have done.'

He examines the weapon closely.

'I see that you folded the metal of the blade and affixed it to the hilt in a nearly flawless manner. Sharpened the blade very well too.

'I think that this is a very good effort and proves that you are prepared to continue your work towards becoming a master weaponsmith.'

'It looks as though you have strayed a little ways from home, [placeholder], and you want to learn to forge weapons meant for fighting back the darkness?

'It seems, then, that you have come to the right place.

'You want to speak with Hannis by the forge. He will be able to set you upon the path of weaponsmithy.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'Weaponsmithy, is it? A fine choice for any self-respecting dwarf!

'We make the finest weapons in all the world, of that there is no doubt.

'Go over to the forge and speak with Hannis. He will set you on the path to becoming another in a long litany of fine weaponsmiths from under the mountains.'

'You are far from home, [placeholder]. We will honour your request and help you as you learn the art of weaponsmithing.

'Dantlassil, near the forge, is an apprentice in the art of weaponsmithy. If you are looking for guidance, I am certain that she will be willing to assist you with the fundamentals of the craft.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'It is without question that the Elves have crafted the most elegant and noteworthy weapons throughout the ages of Middle-earth, and I am pleased to see that though we will soon leave this place, we will continue to focus on the arts which we have perfected in our time here.

'I have asked one of our promising novices to watch over and guide any new weaponsmiths towards learning the very basics of the profession. Her name is Dantlassil, and she stands near the forge here at the terrace.

'Speak with her, and she will teach you the very basics as she progresses in her own studies.'

'You will find Balbo Grubb near the forge here in the Crafting Area. 

'He is one of the few hobbits that I know who has ever wanted to take up that pursuit. He may be a Grubb, but many often wonder if there isn't a little Baggins in him, somewhere in the family tree.

'Speak with him if you are intent on poking things with sharp objects.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>
You have made a bronze blade

'Does your mother know that you want to learn how to make weapons? It is hardly the pursuit of many hobbits.

'If this is what you desire, then who am I to stand in your way? A word of warning though -- weapons hurt if you drop them on your toes.

'You will want to speak with Balbo Bag-- I mean Balbo Grubb, over there by the forge.'
You have made a bronze weapon

'Well, look at you. I do not often see your folk here, and when I do, I always find it a bit queer. Well, hobbits less so because of the hill.

'Oh, I am sorry, you wish to know more of weaponsmithy? It just so happens that there is a fine weaponsmith in this very hall, still learning, but taking to the art very quickly. His name is Bob Birchcutter, and you will find him by the forge in the larger room.

'Good day, [placeholder].'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>
You have made a Bronze Sword!

'Weaponsmithy is a necessity in these dark times. It seems that there is always a new threat here or there, and with Archet being burned to the ground....'

She collects herself.

'I have secured the time and teaching of Bob Birchcutter, a novice weaponsmith, but a fine student who is quickly refining his art, to teach all those who are looking to set out as weaponsmiths.

'He can be found near the forge, here in the Craft Hall of Combe.'

'Hullo, there... I hear that you are interested in learning the ways of a weaponsmith. If so, you have come to the right place.

'I will try to not move too quickly for you, but if I do, speak with me again to ask more pointed questions.

'I almost forgot the most important thing for every new weaponsmith -- ingredients. Everything you need to make a bronze weapon is inside this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Weaponsmith vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Weaponsmith's training and continued work.</rgb>

The art of weaponsmithy reaches back to the First Age of Middle-earth. Those who expend a great deal of energy into this profession are sought after for their finest and even their more mundane works. Weaponsmithy is a difficult, but rewarding profession. As a new weaponsmith, it is best that you learn the basics of your craft.

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Be careful! You will need to complete the correct recipe and deliver the correct item outlined in this quest. 

You will need to execute a bronze weapon recipe and deliver the weapon. Failing to do so will force you to obtain new raw materials or to restart the quest after a 24-hour delay.</rgb>
You have made a bronze weapon
You have made a bronze weapon
Speak with the Novice Weaponcrafter near the forge in the crafting area
You have made a bronze weapon
You have been provided ingredients
You have made a bronze weapon
Open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> given to you by the Novice Weaponcrafter to collect the bronze ingots
You now have all the ingredients to make a bronze weapon
Using the ingredients you received, craft a <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze blade</rgb>
Using the ingredients you have, forge a <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze sword, dagger, axe, great sword, or throwing axe</rgb>
Bring the <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze sword, dagger, axe, great sword, or throwing axe</rgb> to the Novice Weaponcrafter
#-1:[placeholder]Bring the <rgb=#FF00FF00>Bronze Sword</rgb> to #-1:{Balbo[O]|Dantlassil[L]|TBD[D]|Bob}
'Do you have the bronze weapon on you? I do not see it. I hope you did not trade it away or sell it for coin. I would like to inspect that work. You had best find a way to make another.'
You should speak with the Novice Weaponcrafter to learn more about weaponsmithy.

The Novice Weaponcrafter provided you with a <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> full of ingredients that you can use to create a bronze weapon. Open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> to get the ingredients.\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Weaponsmiths are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospecting profession and, in some rare cases, the woodworking profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

#-1:[placeholder]#-1:{Balbo[O]|Dantlassil[L]|Hannis[D]|Bob} provided you with the ingredients necessary to create a bronze sword. First, however, you must prepare the <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze blade</rgb>.
Create a <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze sword, dagger, axe, great sword, or throwing axe</rgb>, as instructed by the Novice Weaponcrafter.
The recipe is complete. <rgb=#FF00FF00>Do not sell the bronze weapon!</rgb> It is time to show your handiwork to the Novice Weaponcrafter.

'If you are looking for guidance in weaponsmithy, then I am prepared to offer you direction.

'If my methods are too fast, feel free to speak to me again, and I will answer any questions that you may have. I will do my best to provide you with clear direction. The first and most important step is having the proper ingredients.

'I have kept some of these ingredients aside for the purpose of providing to new weaponsmiths. Take this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> and let us begin.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Weaponsmith vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Weaponsmith's training and continued work.</rgb>
'You should speak at once with the weaponsmith trainer.'

'Well, look here... another would-be weaponsmith. I am pleased to meet you and looking forward to helping you get started.

'If I go too fast or you need help at any point, you can ask me questions about weaponsmithy, and I will do my best to provide you with clear direction. The first and most important step is having the proper ingredients.

'I set aside a few for new weaponsmiths like yourself. Take this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> and let us begin.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Weaponsmith vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Weaponsmith's training and continued work.</rgb>
'You should speak at once with the weaponsmith trainer.'

'Hello, there. I hear that you are interested in learning the ways of a weaponsmith. If so, you have come to the right place.

'I will try to not move too quickly for you, but if I do, speak with me again to ask more pointed questions.

'I almost forgot the most important thing for every new weaponsmith -- ingredients. Everything you need to make a bronze weapon is inside this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Weaponsmith vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Weaponsmith's training and continued work.</rgb>

'Let me see what you were able to do....'

He inspects the weapon with a discerning eye.

'Well-balanced, and the blade is quite sharp. This is fine work. 

'I think that you have done very, very well, [placeholder]. I approve and declare you a novice weaponsmith.'
'You should speak at once with the weaponsmith trainer.'
'Oh no, did you sell your weapon? Well, I need to inspect one, so you had better find a way to make me another.'

'Making the blade is simple. Take your hammer and ingots to the forge and hammer out the blade. Then you will have everything that you need.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Weaponsmithy tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Weaponsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>

'A nice even pound to the metal. Good folding to make the blade nice and sturdy and a well-seated hilt.

'You pass, [placeholder]. You are on your way towards becoming a master weaponsmith!'

'Good work, so far. Get your hands to work and forge a <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze sword, dagger, axe, great sword, or throwing axe</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Weaponsmithy tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Weaponsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>
'I hope you did not break the weapon on a practice dummy. Or did you sell it for some meagre coin? Well... I cannot pass you without seeing your handiwork. Back to the forge with you!'

'Grab your <rgb=#FF00FF00>smithing hammer</rgb> and make sure you have it equipped, then open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I gave you and make your way to the forge.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Weaponsmiths are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospecting profession and, in some rare cases, the woodworking profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'You will first need to make the blade. Go to the forge and hammer out the blade. This will provide you the key ingredients for the bronze sword.'

'I see the blade there on your person. May I see it?'

She takes a moment to admire your handiwork.

'This appears to be a well-crafted weapon. You are well on your way towards becoming a weaponsmith. Well done, [placeholder].'

'You need to make a <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze sword, dagger, axe, great sword, or throwing axe</rgb> and return it to me for approval.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Weaponsmithy tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Weaponsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>

'Making the blade will be easy. Hammer it out over by the forge. Little else needed to do beyond that.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Weaponsmithy tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Weaponsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>
'Have you forgotten something? I do not see the bronze weapon that you were supposed to deliver to me. You should return with one.'
Introduction to Weaponsmithy

'To make the bronze weapon, you will need to open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I provided to you. Equip your <rgb=#FF00FF00>smithing hammer</rgb>, then head to the forge and begin weaponsmithing.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Weaponsmiths are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospecting profession and, in some rare cases, the woodworking profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'Go on now and make a <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze sword, dagger, axe, great sword, or throwing axe</rgb>.'

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Weaponsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>

'Let me see what you have done.'

He examines the weapon closely.

'I see that you folded the metal of the blade and affixed it to the hilt in a nearly flawless manner. Sharpened the blade very well too.

'I think that this is a very good effort and proves that you are prepared to continue your work towards becoming a master weaponsmith.'

'Just open up that <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> full of ingredients that I gave you, and you can start making the bronze weapon over by the forge. Make sure to equip your <rgb=#FF00FF00>smithing hammer!</rgb>'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Weaponsmiths are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospecting profession and, in some rare cases, the woodworking profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'Making the blade is simple. Take your hammer and ingots to the forge and hammer out the blade. Then you will have everything that you need.'
